intro: Eulophidium mackenii, commonly known as the Mackenzie's eulophidium, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native environment.
